(2 comments)

I'll defer to Brian and Abhi on whether or not the location is the right place to store it. It seems like just a transient piece of data we need to stash temporarily to me..."}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2021-01-19 12:39:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2021-01-19 12:39:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2021-01-19 12:41:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2021-01-21 17:31:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)

I'm still -1 on the location based approach until I understand why. Apologies if I'm being daft, but hopefully we can have some other voices in here soon to help push this one way or the other."}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2021-01-22 14:15:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I am also thinking adding staging_host as a reserved property will be much easier than adding it to location table;
1. because we generate location url once data is fully uploaded to backend
2. once import is complete we delete the data from staging area and then we need to set it to null/none if we added it to location table
3. We can restrict creation/update of reserved properties (os_glance_*) by which we don't need to worry about restrictions at CRUD level

But we also need to make sure that in case of failure while reverting if staging data is deleted then we should delete that reserved property as well."}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2021-01-22 22:14:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I like the overall direction of the spec, namely that the node that receives staged data records itself in the Image object, and when the import is requested, the request gets forwarded to the node that has the data.  As far as where the node url goes, my intuition is that we should only use the locations for "real" image data, and using an image property (like we're doing for the task lock) seems like it fits the purpose.

Erno, if you feel strongly about storing the node url in the image locations, let's set up a quick videoconf among the Glance team so you can explain your thinking.  There may be a point here that we're missing that hasn't quite come through in the spec text.'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2021-01-27 05:27:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

After going through specs I found couple of benefits of storing staging_host in locations table;

1. We should create location entry for staging data with valid location url and setting is_active false which will help us to get rid of dodgy code which we use to load staging store on the fly and delete the staging data, instead we could use locations.pop call(url) which will help us to delete staging data as well. 

2. We could use same redirection mechanism to redirect delete image call to the api node where staging data is present, this we could achieve with reserved property approach as well, but if the said glance node is down for maintenance then we don't have any way to make sure that staging data is deleted but with the help of entry in locations table we have track that there is data present somewhere.

Instead of adding new column to locations table we could add this information as a location metadata and we could also hide this staging data information from displaying to end user.

So the reserved property approach is easy one and the approach mentioned in this specs is trickier but help us to improve and reuse the glance-store code."}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2021-01-27 15:03:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> 1. We should create location entry for staging data with valid location url and setting is_active false which will help us to get rid of dodgy code which we use to load staging store on the fly and delete the staging data, instead we could use locations.pop call(url) which will help us to delete staging data as well. 

I don't understand what benefit this has. Can you explain more?

> 2. We could use same redirection mechanism to redirect delete image call to the api node where staging data is present, this we could achieve with reserved property approach as well, but if the said glance node is down for maintenance then we don't have any way to make sure that staging data is deleted but with the help of entry in locations table we have track that there is data present somewhere.

I'm already doing this with my property-based implementation, as you note. AFAICT, this is exactly the same with the property approach - we can still harvest that after image delete if we want right? Either way, glance-api already needs to examine its staging store on startup and delete any residue there right? A failed import that was in progress at power fail time, or presumably any failure that happened across a DB cleanup boundary.

> Instead of adding new column to locations table we could add this information as a location metadata and we could also hide this staging data information from displaying to end user.
> 
> So the reserved property approach is easy one and the approach mentioned in this specs is trickier but help us to improve and reuse the glance-store code.

Can you point specifically to what actually gets reused? It sounds like more change will be needed with this approach, but perhaps I'm missing some store routines that will save massive amounts of time.

Is there any harm in moving forward with the known-to-be-working simple approach, given where we are in the cycle, and then someone following up with a patch to use the store instead? That would give us a way to examine just the delta between the two. If not, I'd still propose that the patch be added on top of mine to show the differences, even if we squash them later.

Getting this fixed in a workable way seems to have been dragging for many releases at this point. I'd hate to see a working implementation further delayed here, as it has already been thus far."}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2021-01-27 19:57:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> I'm already doing this with my property-based implementation, as you note. AFAICT, this is exactly the same with the property approach - we can still harvest that after image delete if we want right? Either way, glance-api already needs to examine its staging store on startup and delete any residue there right? A failed import that was in progress at power fail time, or presumably any failure that happened across a DB cleanup boundary.

I just confirmed using this (and without my patch which proxies delete):

https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/devstack/+/770487

That if I stage against one worker and delete on the other, it'll just leave residue in the staging store. So, I think unrelated to whatever we decide here, glance workers should be cleaning (probably at least on startup) their staging repository if they find files there that are related to deleted images, yeah?"}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2021-01-28 05:34:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> Patch Set 3:
> 
> > 1. We should create location entry for staging data with valid location url and setting is_active false which will help us to get rid of dodgy code which we use to load staging store on the fly and delete the staging data, instead we could use locations.pop call(url) which will help us to delete staging data as well. 
> 
> I don't understand what benefit this has. Can you explain more?

I was talking about this call [1]. If you add location entry of staged data then you could use this call which internally uses glance-store code to delete the data from the backend, whereas at the moment we are using [2] to delete the staged data in which we are either using os calls to clear the data or creating location url manually then fetching the store object with that and calling delete method of store.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/glance/blob/master/glance/location.py#L235
[2] https://github.com/openstack/glance/blob/master/glance/api/v2/image_data.py#L80


> 
> > 2. We could use same redirection mechanism to redirect delete image call to the api node where staging data is present, this we could achieve with reserved property approach as well, but if the said glance node is down for maintenance then we don't have any way to make sure that staging data is deleted but with the help of entry in locations table we have track that there is data present somewhere.
> 
> I'm already doing this with my property-based implementation, as you note. AFAICT, this is exactly the same with the property approach - we can still harvest that after image delete if we want right? Either way, glance-api already needs to examine its staging store on startup and delete any residue there right? A failed import that was in progress at power fail time, or presumably any failure that happened across a DB cleanup boundary.
> 
> > Instead of adding new column to locations table we could add this information as a location metadata and we could also hide this staging data information from displaying to end user.
> > 
> > So the reserved property approach is easy one and the approach mentioned in this specs is trickier but help us to improve and reuse the glance-store code.
> 
> Can you point specifically to what actually gets reused? It sounds like more change will be needed with this approach, but perhaps I'm missing some store routines that will save massive amounts of time.
> 
> Is there any harm in moving forward with the known-to-be-working simple approach, given where we are in the cycle, and then someone following up with a patch to use the store instead? That would give us a way to examine just the delta between the two. If not, I'd still propose that the patch be added on top of mine to show the differences, even if we squash them later.
> 
> Getting this fixed in a workable way seems to have been dragging for many releases at this point. I'd hate to see a working implementation further delayed here, as it has already been thus far.

I am open to move forward with reserved property approach and then in Xena revisiting the same and do it using the locations way."}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2021-02-04 14:13:56.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Distrbuted Image Import via request proxying

This spec is split of section from
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/664956/ to specifically
address the Interoperable Image Import: glance-direct
needs.

If I understand correctly, the issue occurs because we're choosing a PCI device to use on the destination host via the 'check_can_live_migrate_destination' method (or specifically the '_update_migrate_vifs_profile_with_pci' helper), however, we're later attempting to find the device name for this device using the 'get_ifname_by_pci_address' method and we're running that on the *source* host. Clearly that will break if inventory is different. Is that correct? If so, see my comments inline. commit_message:
SRIOV: Fix instance with macvtap port live migration failed

VIFMigrateData profile_json add 'dest_devname' for
pci device name on destination host allocated for
instance attached macvtap vnic_type port.

For the sr-iov device pci slot and device name
on source compute maybe different with the destination
compute node, the 'dest_devname' is used to store
the VF device name allocated on destination host
and source compute service generate correct
target new vm xml.

Change-Id: I33b5559e9caa2f9d3a000925ea799b10b0c3211d
Closes-Bug: #1885558

commit_message:
Use global service variables

Instead of overriding each service separatelly it might make
sense for deployers to define some higher level variable that
will be used first or fallback to default variable.

Depends-On: If3f28603b591782d851c4f333e3b1dcee39a0aac
Change-Id: If5bcf9337a2957a729daff03a447fe9b1b2fd236

commit_message:
Update tripleo-validations roles with new validations framework

- Drops old Validations run through Mistral
- Drops old negative tests
- Adds run-validations-cli-tests.sh to validate the CLI.
- Adds run-validations-standalone-tests.sh to run standalone tests

Refs: https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/epic/1054

Depends-On: Ie80318a7fa684adb7c3bf7c99d526b0de64b0904
Change-Id: If3e211c09fbf047460f526742f3c0d468c2a52ae
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add support for image download via rbd

This change introduces some new parameters to the nova::glance class,
which are required for the new feature to download glance image via
RBD instead of API[1].

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/nova/+/574301

Conflicts:
  manifests/glance.pp
  spec/classes/nova_glance_spec.rb

Change-Id: I0c9ebc5fd980204c59cc903372820e1ee1245630
(cherry picked from commit 896bf1ff5e17543197d6fb759bf293879481c909)

commit_message:
Add parameter to configure the libvirt max_queues

The maximum number of virtio queue pairs that can be enabled when
creating a multiqueue guest. The number of virtio queues allocated
will be the lesser of the CPUs requested by the guest and the max
value defined.

Conflicts:
  spec/classes/nova_compute_libvirt_spec.rb

Change-Id: Ieaa29b51257f5ea3a5e4d6c678140fd9ae052d88
(cherry picked from commit 8a6de56193a18678927b4584917246df6bb89b63)
(cherry picked from commit eed4d2dc1bf1db3913edd8dd2fa1140fb4a1abee)
(cherry picked from commit d5616aae194c458c35977b54f2da24ca29e46682)

@hemna,

I find that the when removing the volume, Cinder will unexport and unregister the disk, but from gwcli side, I saw that the image metadata has show like this:

/disks> ls
o- disks ......................................................................................................... [0.00Y, Disks: 6]
  o- volumes ..................................................................................................... [volumes (0.00Y)]
    o- volume-00869512-1f1d-4b60-8c32-eaf0f802a566 ..................................................................... [NOT FOUND]
    o- volume-2152ce6f-943c-4210-9399-e87ce4f9bd72 ..................................................................... [NOT FOUND]

The deleted volumes has not been cleaned at the /disks, should we also add a method to clean it?'}, {'account_id': 22076, 'date': '2020-08-04 07:45:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 27:

> @hemna,
 > 
 > I find that the when removing the volume, Cinder will unexport and
 > unregister the disk, but from gwcli side, I saw that the image
 > metadata has show like this:
 > 
 > /disks> ls
 > o- disks .........................................................................................................
 > [0.00Y, Disks: 6]
 > o- volumes .....................................................................................................
 > [volumes (0.00Y)]
 > o- volume-00869512-1f1d-4b60-8c32-eaf0f802a566 .....................................................................
 > [NOT FOUND]
 > o- volume-2152ce6f-943c-4210-9399-e87ce4f9bd72 .....................................................................
 > [NOT FOUND]
 > 
 > The deleted volumes has not been cleaned at the /disks, should we
 > also add a method to clean it?

Regarding to this case:
I saw the log consequence from devstack@c-vol is:
Call unexport lun volumes/volume-*
Call unexporting volumes/volume-*
Call rbd to delete: deleting rbd volume volume-*

So we can see that the volume has been moved by RBD, and from Iscsi gwcli the volume are "NOT FOUND" as shown before.
Is it possible for Cinder ISCSI driver to have an individual delete_volume method to refine the process?'}, {'account_id': 5997, 'date': '2020-08-04 14:19:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 28.'}, {'account_id': 26537, 'date': '2020-08-04 15:35:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 28:

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-03 19:14:07.000000000', 'message': "WIP Add ceph iscsi volume driver

This patch is a research project WIP.
It's GARBAGE, but I needed a place to store the work.

This is a new driver that makes heavy use of the ceph-iscsi project's
rbd-target-api python REST client here:
https://github.com/ceph/ceph-iscsi

The rbd-target-api is a python script meant to keep ceph iscsi gw nodes in
sync with each other, but the API is works for creating iscsi targets.

The driver is a derivation of the rbd driver, and the intention is to reuse
as much of the base rbd driver as possible and just do iSCSI specific
code here.

What 'works':
  All of the non overridden methods from the rbd driver.
  initialize_connection worked...once.

TODO:
  Terminate connection
  CHAP credentials
  testing

Change-Id: Iff0e4d1137851c8f0b8ec25632d1186c2859b2fc
"}, {'created': '2019-06-04 19:59:57.000000000', 'message': "WIP Add ceph iscsi volume driver

This patch is a research project WIP.
It's GARBAGE, but I needed a place to store the work.

This is a new driver that makes heavy use of the ceph-iscsi project's
rbd-target-api python REST client here:
https://github.com/ceph/ceph-iscsi

The rbd-target-api is a python script meant to keep ceph iscsi gw nodes in
sync with each other, but the API is works for creating iscsi targets.

The driver is a derivation of the rbd driver, and the intention is to reuse
as much of the base rbd driver as possible and just do iSCSI specific
code here.

What 'works':
  All of the non overridden methods from the rbd driver.
  initialize_connection worked...once with a disk already in the gw.
  Terminate connection worked....once.

TODO:
  CHAP credentials
  need to create disk before adding it during initialize_connection
  testing

Change-Id: Iff0e4d1137851c8f0b8ec25632d1186c2859b2fc
"}, {'created': '2019-06-07 14:31:03.000000000', 'message': "WIP Add ceph iscsi volume driver

This patch is a research project WIP.
It's GARBAGE, but I needed a place to store the work.

This is a new driver that makes heavy use of the ceph-iscsi project's
rbd-target-api python REST client here:
https://github.com/ceph/ceph-iscsi

The rbd-target-api is a python script meant to keep ceph iscsi gw nodes in
sync with each other, but the API is works for creating iscsi targets.

The driver is a derivation of the rbd driver, and the intention is to reuse
as much of the base rbd driver as possible and just do iSCSI specific
code here.

What 'works':
  All of the non overridden methods from the rbd driver.
  initialize_connection works
  Terminate connection worked....once.

TODO:
  CHAP credentials

Change-Id: Iff0e4d1137851c8f0b8ec25632d1186c2859b2fc
"}, {'created': '2019-06-11 16:01:52.000000000', 'message': "WIP Add ceph iscsi volume driver

This patch is a research project WIP.
It's GARBAGE, but I needed a place to store the work.

This is a new driver that makes heavy use of the ceph-iscsi project's
rbd-target-api python REST client here:
https://github.com/ceph/ceph-iscsi

The rbd-target-api is a python script meant to keep ceph iscsi gw nodes in
sync with each other, but the API is works for creating iscsi targets.

The driver is a derivation of the rbd driver, and the intention is to reuse
as much of the base rbd driver as possible and just do iSCSI specific
code here.

What 'works':
  All of the non overridden methods from the rbd driver.
  initialize_connection works
  Terminate connection works

TODO:
  CHAP credentials
  testing

Change-Id: Iff0e4d1137851c8f0b8ec25632d1186c2859b2fc

commit_message:
Add ceph iscsi volume driver

The driver requires the new rbd-iscsi-client package, which is used
to talk to the rbd-target-api on the ceph iscsi gateway node.

The rbd-target-api is a python script meant to keep ceph iscsi gw nodes in
sync with each other, but the API is works for creating iscsi targets.
This is a new driver that makes heavy use of the ceph-iscsi project's
rbd-target-api python REST client here:
https://github.com/ceph/ceph-iscsi

The driver is a derivation of the rbd driver, and the intention is to reuse
as much of the base rbd driver as possible and just do iSCSI specific
code here.

Change-Id: Iff0e4d1137851c8f0b8ec25632d1186c2859b2fc

commit_message:
Don't use swift plan when exporting passwords

This changes to use the stack environment instead for
passwords when using ``overcloud export`` or
``overcloud cell export``.

Change-Id: Iae58a6415cc12e2035e0d3b62327e59e038d1b2c

subject: Remove plan/plan-role management commands
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 7144, 'name': 'James Slagle', 'email': 'jslagle@redhat.com', 'username': 'slagle'}, {'_account_id': 7353, 'name': 'Kevin Carter', 'email': 'kevin@cloudnull.com', 'username': 'cloudnull'}, {'_account_id': 8449, 'name': 'Marios Andreou', 'email': 'marios@redhat.com', 'username': 'marios'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2021-01-28 02:34:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2021-01-28 04:42:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2021-01-29 03:26:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2021-02-01 04:21:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: New patch set was added with same tree, parent, and commit message as Patch Set 2.'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2021-02-01 05:26:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: Patch Set 3 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2021-02-01 15:10:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2021-02-01 22:25:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1

I think we still need the concept of a "plan". I'd like to see under /var/lib/tripleo/<stack>, every single file saved used to do the deployment, including:

- full copy of the templates specified with --templates
- every environment file / custom template used outside of the template dir
- some record of the deployment command or environment ordering
- rendered templates
- config-download generated dir
- deployment and ansible log

That would give us at the equivalency of what we had with the plan, which is important for debugability. I completely agree with Alex's comment on https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/python-tripleoclient/+/765808

We need to have everything saved in one easily accessible place like we had with the plan.

If we agree on that, then I think this patch is reasonable. But, we will need to document how to access the list of plans, query them, and save them, etc. Which can be as simple as cd /var/lib/tripleo; ls;

I think with switching to the Heat server side env merging, we lost some of what was previously saved in the plan, so we just need an equivalent way to reconstruct exactly what was used in the deployment easily.'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2021-02-02 02:06:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> I think we still need the concept of a "plan". I'd like to see under /var/lib/tripleo/<stack>, every single file saved used to do the deployment

Why another place that stores state of deployment? Don't we want templates used by the user as the single source of truth? If we deploy from that plan directory like earlier from swift container,
there is every chance we'll have the same issues as before (changing files there directly would impact deplyments like plan earlier).
If you use --no-cleanup you would have most of the contents that used for deployment in the temp directory which we archive[1] now by default (jinja rendered files, full copy of templates and the generated env files).
As per the order of environments it's in the deploy command.

> That would give us at the equivalency of what we had with the plan, which is important for debugability. I completely agree with Alex's comment on https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/python-tripleoclient/+/765808

I think we addressed that concern Alex had by archiving[2] the contents of temp deployment directory.


> If we agree on that, then I think this patch is reasonable. But, we will need to document how to access the list of plans, query them, and save them, etc. Which can be as simple as cd /var/lib/tripleo; ls;

As mentioned earlier I don't see why we need another place to store deployment state (i.e we already have them in templates, stack and the ansible playbooks). 

> I think with switching to the Heat server side env merging, we lost some of what was previously saved in the plan, so we just need an equivalent way to reconstruct exactly what was used in the deployment easily.

Heat server side env merging deploys from the temp directory and not from swift and we don't store order of envs in plan as we pass them to heat directly as specfied in the delploy command.
So the deploy command and the archived temp directory should reconstruct the exact deployment.


[1] https://74ba446c67330cee3803-f02df998996ed1443c598eea926aa5c3.ssl.cf5.rackcdn.com/772821/4/check/tripleo-ci-centos-8-containers-multinode/f775f96/logs/undercloud/home/zuul/overcloud-install-20210201073248.tar.bzip2
[2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/python-tripleoclient/+/772622'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2021-02-02 02:08:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> As per the order of environments it's in the deploy command.

Please ignore that line in my last comment."}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2021-02-02 04:22:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/python-tripleoclient/+/773565 would also add the user provided environment files to the archive (i.e all that the plan had other than plan-environment.yaml that had the merged environment) and should be sufficient to reproduce the environment.'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2021-02-02 14:55:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> Patch Set 4:
> 
> > I think we still need the concept of a "plan". I'd like to see under /var/lib/tripleo/<stack>, every single file saved used to do the deployment
> 
> Why another place that stores state of deployment? Don't we want templates used by the user as the single source of truth? If we deploy from that plan directory like earlier from swift container,
> there is every chance we'll have the same issues as before (changing files there directly would impact deplyments like plan earlier).
> If you use --no-cleanup you would have most of the contents that used for deployment in the temp directory which we archive[1] now by default (jinja rendered files, full copy of templates and the generated env files).

That's all I'm asking for really, just that we have the entire set of files needed to reproduce the deployment in a single location. I'll take a look at the additional patch to add user environments, that would likely cover it.

As long as a user can provide that tgz for debugging, and it contains at least the equivalency of what we had in the plan, then I'm happy. Or, at least that is the intent we're moving towards.'}, {'account_id': 27419, 'date': '2021-02-02 16:12:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> Patch Set 4:
> 
> https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/python-tripleoclient/+/773565 would also add the user provided environment files to the archive (i.e all that the plan had other than plan-environment.yaml that had the merged environment) and should be sufficient to reproduce the environment.

I believe we should have the --no-cleanup set by default. Lifecycle operations are pretty engaging and asking an operator to re-run with --no-cleanup can be a hassle. Before, we could just pull the plans from swift to see the generated templates. Unless I'm missing something and these files are always available somewhere else."}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2021-02-03 03:01:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> I believe we should have the --no-cleanup set by default.

As I mentioned earlier we archive the whole directory[1] (contents used to be in plan) by default. So if someone is lazy to extract that, can use --no-celanup;)


[1] https://storage.gra.cloud.ovh.net/v1/AUTH_dcaab5e32b234d56b626f72581e3644c/zuul_opendev_logs_bc0/773565/2/check/tripleo-ci-centos-8-containers-multinode/bc063ac/logs/undercloud/home/zuul/overcloud-install-20210202071647.tar.bzip2'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2021-02-04 05:13:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

If we don't have any concerns now, can we merge this patch as it is blocking the whole series?"}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2021-02-04 08:17:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)

> Patch Set 4:
> 
> > Patch Set 4:
> > 
> > > I think we still need the concept of a "plan". I'd like to see under /var/lib/tripleo/<stack>, every single file saved used to do the deployment
> > 
> > Why another place that stores state of deployment? Don't we want templates used by the user as the single source of truth? If we deploy from that plan directory like earlier from swift container,
> > there is every chance we'll have the same issues as before (changing files there directly would impact deplyments like plan earlier).

> > If you use --no-cleanup you would have most of the contents that used for deployment in the temp directory which we archive[1] now by default (jinja rendered files, full copy of templates and the generated env files).
> 

"most of the contents" can you think of something that isn't there?

i just went looking at https://storage.gra.cloud.ovh.net/v1/AUTH_dcaab5e32b234d56b626f72581e3644c/zuul_opendev_logs_bc0/773565/2/check/tripleo-ci-centos-8-containers-multinode/bc063ac/logs/undercloud/home/zuul/overcloud-install-20210202071647.tar.bzip2 - and indeed it contains the 'raw' tripleo-heat-templates i.e. not the rendered jinja, however, it also does include all the parameters under a "user-environments" including the tripleoclient-parameters directory so you could recreate the stack/rendered templates if needed. 

+1 mainly for inline thought about the commands and if there is any value in keeping the commands, even if we remove what they're wired up for.'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2021-02-04 08:36:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)

>  and indeed it contains the 'raw' tripleo-heat-templates i.e. not the rendered jinja, 

Not sure what you mean raw templates. You should see all jinja rendered templates ex. overcloud-resource-registry-puppet.yaml, overcloud.yaml along with their j2 files. It has everything that used to be in plan before."}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2021-02-04 09:12:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

(1 comment)'}]

commit_message:
Remove plan/plan-role management commands

This removes all the plan related commands as we
won't have a plan.

Change-Id: I77d4fa6e0fa88f3e0429e7dea9115f0460a16c5c

The 1.6.3 [1] release has dropped support for py2 [2] but the release
is faulty and pip still picks it up for py2 [3][4], so cap to 1.6.2

commit_message:
[stable-only] Cap bandit and fix lower-constraints

The 1.6.3 [1] release has dropped support for py2 [2] but the release
is faulty and pip still picks it up for py2 [3][4], so cap to 1.6.2
when using py2.

Contradicting hacking version replaced (in lower-constraints.txt to
match with test-requirements.txt), which pulls in newer flake8, too.

[1] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/releases/tag/1.6.3
[2] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/pull/615
[3] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/issues/663
[4] https://github.com/PyCQA/bandit/issues/665

Change-Id: I0c50a5d70cd288cea3fe05a23dcb474cde176caa

commit_message:
Disable test_create_cluster_with_zero_nodes

Cluster creation fails on the CI due to an issue similar to what we've
seen before for another test (test_create_list_sign_delete_clusters).
Disable it for now.

story: 2007272
task: 38867

story: 2007851
task: 41443

Change-Id: Ie91fdfe71058b45c5fd1217920b8b5b993e47734

commit_message:
Fix lxc_hosts_container_image_url condition

lxc_hosts_container_image_url is string, so can't be passed through bool
filter as it will always result as false.

Change-Id: I0f12760840d81c9d73118d63bc0927eab78b9df2
Closes-Bug: #1908544
(cherry picked from commit bd40afa00ad88c35b7916c9f9bf8f25c5fef0647)

commit_message:
Install rsync for CentOS bootstrap

We use rsync to copy selinux modules into ansible venv,
but never care about installing rsync for that.
We also drop hook made for compatability with CentOS 7

Closes-Bug: #1913204
Change-Id: I02aa3b85582301a93ccb5ad7c921bd3c10a787db
(cherry picked from commit 7293771b72b4b5afa0b16cc9a89bda5f8c1e6320)

commit_message:
Make the default transport POLL_SERVER_HEAT

Change it to POLL_SERVER_HEAT (Attempt 2, Earlier attempt had
issues when changing this as simultaneously deleting a bunch
of SoftwareDeployment resources). This is required to remove
swift from undercloud.

messages: [{'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2021-02-03 17:51:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2021-02-03 17:52:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2021-02-04 10:10:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-03 17:51:20.000000000', 'message': 'Fix nova_libvirt_images_rbd_pool check

nova_libvirt_images_rbd_pool is a string, so applying bool filter always
results to false, which ends up in incorrect behaviour and nova does
not use ceph storage for ephemeral drives.

Change-Id: I66decd266655680172c3e272df61313bde652479
Closes-Bug: #1914272
(cherry picked from commit ca7eed516eb82150446a28bd6ed023d43f9cb1d8)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix nova_libvirt_images_rbd_pool check

nova_libvirt_images_rbd_pool is a string, so applying bool filter always
results to false, which ends up in incorrect behaviour and nova does
not use ceph storage for ephemeral drives.

Change-Id: I66decd266655680172c3e272df61313bde652479
Closes-Bug: #1914272
(cherry picked from commit ca7eed516eb82150446a28bd6ed023d43f9cb1d8)

commit_message:
[DNM] Test without python-pip centos7 binary install

python-pip not in centos base repo, in rdo it's only
provided in build-deps repo, testing to see if it's
really needed in binary installs.

Was added with https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/kolla/+/758057.

Change-Id: Iab619662b17fbdc527d56d240d885413c3569634

subject: Add doc/requirements
messages: [{'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-01-06 11:17:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2021-02-04 11:36:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-01-06 11:17:23.000000000', 'message': "Add doc/requirements

We need to specify doc requirements in doc/requirements.txt
to avoid problems with the pip resolver [1] for the release team [2][3].
Removed specific doc requirements from test-requirements.txt.

The problem here is that this repos haven't doc/requirements.txt file
and by default in this case zuul will use the test-requirements.txt file
to pull requirements [4].

This requirements file contains extra requirements like flake8 that
collided with those allowed in our job environment and so the new pip
resolver fails to install these requirements and the job exits in error.

This project meet the conditions leading to the bug.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/release-job-failures/2021-January/001500.html
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019611.html
[3] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019612.html
[4] https://opendev.org/zuul/zuul-jobs/src/branch/master/roles/ensure-sphinx/tasks/main.yaml#L36

Change-Id: Iff1936fb96ca51c3f909bef3e975fa6ca6ad3abf
"}]
commit_message:
Add doc/requirements

We need to specify doc requirements in doc/requirements.txt
to avoid problems with the pip resolver [1] for the release team [2][3].
Removed specific doc requirements from test-requirements.txt.

The problem here is that this repos haven't doc/requirements.txt file
and by default in this case zuul will use the test-requirements.txt file
to pull requirements [4].

This requirements file contains extra requirements like flake8 that
collided with those allowed in our job environment and so the new pip
resolver fails to install these requirements and the job exits in error.

This project meet the conditions leading to the bug.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/release-job-failures/2021-January/001500.html
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019611.html
[3] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019612.html
[4] https://opendev.org/zuul/zuul-jobs/src/branch/master/roles/ensure-sphinx/tasks/main.yaml#L36

Change-Id: Iff1936fb96ca51c3f909bef3e975fa6ca6ad3abf

messages: [{'account_id': 11491, 'date': '2021-02-01 11:13:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 32926, 'date': '2021-02-03 07:23:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2021-02-04 07:35:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1\n\nBackport - let's merge it."}]

This patch is displaying the content of the validation_output dictionary
which is a simplified output content (the former validation_output)
instead of dumping the entire log file in the stdout.

It also fixes the --full argument which was True forever!

Change-Id: Id94132d23d272d383b65a839a75b08f855fb6be3

'}]
commit_message:
[Validator Show Run] Display simplified results by default

This patch is displaying the content of the validation_output dictionary
which is a simplified output content (the former validation_output)
instead of dumping the entire log file in the stdout.

It also fixes the --full argument which was True forever!

Change-Id: Id94132d23d272d383b65a839a75b08f855fb6be3
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud (Strider) <gchamoul@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 4229bee94016ad5a78dd8455f282a8e7f4a3d28e)
(cherry picked from commit 7873e6d800d75119730c7cd8ff1152fe08aa1c49)

commit_message:
Add post-deployment frr_status validation

The frr_status is a post-deployment validation that checks for
non-operational FRR daemons.

Change-Id: I78089c0203593fd45b887c9ebc7558bc8b5e3162

commit_message:
nova: Release Victoria 22.1.0

Minor version bump due to patch
4e5b92545d Add upgrade check about old computes
(I873b0c1e6e695ae88241bbf75ac9f80ecc6f5664).

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 22.0.1..HEAD
eebf94b654 compute: Lock by instance.uuid lock during swap_volume
63d2e62c3a Use subqueryload() instead of joinedload() for (system_)metadata
6b57575092 Fallback to same-cell resize with qos ports
7366e3c375 Reproduce bug 1907522 in functional test
4e5b92545d Add upgrade check about old computes
0c5ca351e2 Warn when starting services with older than N-1 computes
e3da2ca7be lower-constraints: Bump packaging to 20.4
c3a0969329 Omit resource inventories from placement update if zero
eda458828b compute: Don't detach volumes when RescheduledException raised without retry
95fc161334 Add regression test for bug #1899649
478be6f4fb zuul: Replace nova-live-migration with zuulv3 jobs
f4d62e1a0b Fix a hacking test
82d415d200 Add missing exception
3ecc098d28 Set instance host and drop migration under lock
d768cdbb88 Reproduce bug 1896463 in func env
9a5b6249d6 Use cell targeted context to query BDMs for metadata

Change-Id: Ie8d769c593f6606d95afa761fce3c15420b2af64

36eefd9c0e docs: Resolve issue with deprecated extra specs

We should have https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/772401 first, to have "ports_bulk" first.'}, {'account_id': 5948, 'date': '2021-02-04 06:40:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> We should have https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/772401 first, to have "ports_bulk" first.

Yeah, but in fact it will just work as works now: condition at https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/773592/1/neutron/services/qos/qos_plugin.py#105 will always be false before https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/772401 merges. That's why I considered it safe to merge in any order.'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2021-02-04 08:24:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> We should have https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/772401 first, to have "ports_bulk" first.

It is merged now. So this one should be good to go IMO'}]

commit_message:
Optimize get_ports with QoS extension

Apply qos resource extend func for a full list of ports,
not for each port individually, thus avoiding DB queries for each
individual port.
This should drastically improve port list time in case of many
ports/network with QoS policies assigned.

Change-Id: I1d0b3975ae6e92e34e9da20a0e26ce024422d332
Closes-Bug: #1905726
(cherry picked from commit 2a6fd9d44d8ab1eed038ad1348ed767bd6a6e61a)

messages:
[{'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2021-01-29 14:31:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 18031, 'date': '2021-01-30 00:46:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2021-02-01 00:23:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Neutron stable release was released only a couple of days ago (Jan 28).
There are several open backports and it looks better to wait for them for a while (unless we need an immediate release)'}, {'account_id': 18031, 'date': '2021-02-01 04:43:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> Neutron stable release was released only a couple of days ago (Jan 28).
> There are several open backports and it looks better to wait for them for a while (unless we need an immediate release)

Do you have a sense of when the window would close? The release that was just cut unfortunately included https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/770033, which introduced a bug that breaks the group-based-policy project, and the fix for it (https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/771599) wasn't included in the release. We would create a workaround patch in our project until a new release is created, so if it's created soon, we would probably just decide not to create that patch."}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2021-02-01 11:34:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> > Neutron stable release was released only a couple of days ago (Jan 28).
> > There are several open backports and it looks better to wait for them for a while (unless we need an immediate release)
> 
> Do you have a sense of when the window would close? The release that was just cut unfortunately included https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/770033, which introduced a bug that breaks the group-based-policy project, and the fix for it (https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/771599) wasn't included in the release. We would create a workaround patch in our project until a new release is created, so if it's created soon, we would probably just decide not to create that patch.

All open reviews in stable/train already have single +2, so I don't think it take long. I added active stable cores in neutron to the reviewers here.

In addition, it would be really nice when you file a bug against neutron on such breakage. When I checked unreleased merged commits and I checked the commit you mentioned but no bug was linked in the commit and I did not think it is so important. I just thought it makes the behavior more consistent and we can release it as best-effort basis."}, {'account_id': 18031, 'date': '2021-02-01 12:18:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> > > Neutron stable release was released only a couple of days ago (Jan 28).
> > > There are several open backports and it looks better to wait for them for a while (unless we need an immediate release)
> > 
> > Do you have a sense of when the window would close? The release that was just cut unfortunately included https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/770033, which introduced a bug that breaks the group-based-policy project, and the fix for it (https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/771599) wasn't included in the release. We would create a workaround patch in our project until a new release is created, so if it's created soon, we would probably just decide not to create that patch.
> 
> All open reviews in stable/train already have single +2, so I don't think it take long. I added active stable cores in neutron to the reviewers here.
> 
> In addition, it would be really nice when you file a bug against neutron on such breakage. When I checked unreleased merged commits and I checked the commit you mentioned but no bug was linked in the commit and I did not think it is so important. I just thought it makes the behavior more consistent and we can release it as best-effort basis.

Good point, and my apologies for not doing that (this is a good example of why following the process is important). I'll be sure to create a bug and reference it in the commit message next time. Thanks!"}, {'account_id': 21798, 'date': '2021-02-03 07:56:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Same, sorry I had seen 771599 as a small follow-up change, not bugfix. I will check pending open backports, and once the list looks good we can certainly make a new train trag'}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2021-02-03 08:10:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> Same, sorry I had seen 771599 as a small follow-up change, not bugfix. I will check pending open backports, and once the list looks good we can certainly make a new train trag

No problem, thanks for responding :) Do you want me to abandon this patch or do you want to update this patch later on?'}, {'account_id': 31245, 'date': '2021-02-03 08:41:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 21798, 'date': '2021-02-03 16:50:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

> 
> No problem, thanks for responding :) Do you want me to abandon this patch or do you want to update this patch later on?

Checking, tag is almost up-to-date and looking at https://review.opendev.org/q/project:openstack/neutron+branch:stable/train+status:open list is short and does not have ussuri/victoria backports merged yet.

So I'd say we can even use this tag directly, what do you think slaweq/amotoki?"}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2021-02-04 07:08:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

>

Thanks for the detail check, Bernard. I agree with you.
We have three open reviews. Two of them need to wait ussuri/victoria backports and one is test only change. Let's move forward with the current version."}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-02-04 09:29:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2021-02-04 10:30:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Add neutron_keepalived_no_track variable

Until neutron bug is not fixed, we should control whether to use no_track
for keepalived or not, based on the distro version
We should probably rollback it once upstream bug got fixed and bumped.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/764976
Change-Id: I539dfd90576b34693eb8e7aef9f97e64739700ae
Related-Bug: #1896506
(cherry picked from commit 24d64bbd52a11d82c8891f2bc77e666b7ddd35d1)

nova: Release Train 20.5.0

Minor version bump is needed because of the new config option in ptach
I9abe783a9a9443c799e7c74a57cc30835f679a01
(286d7cfc5c add [libvirt]/max_queues config option).

74b2af473c docs: Rework the PCI passthrough guides

286d7cfc5c add [libvirt]/max_queues config option

commit_message:
Add nvme-cli package to IPA image

This change adds nvme-cli utility to the IPA image, which is required to
enable IPA to perform NVMe specific cleaning on supported devices.

Story: 2008290
Task: 41168
Change-Id: I2f63db9b739e53699bd5f164b79640927bf757d7

commit_message:
Optimize get_ports with QoS extension

Apply qos resource extend func for a full list of ports,
not for each port individually, thus avoiding DB queries for each
individual port.
This should drastically improve port list time in case of many
ports/network with QoS policies assigned.

Change-Id: I1d0b3975ae6e92e34e9da20a0e26ce024422d332
Closes-Bug: #1905726
(cherry picked from commit 2a6fd9d44d8ab1eed038ad1348ed767bd6a6e61a)

commit_message:
Retire tempest-horizon

As disscussed in Wallaby PTG [1], QA and Horizon team
decided to move the horizon dashboard test from tempest-horizon
to Tempest. Scenario tests in tempest-horizon have been merged
into the tempest repository.

[1] https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/qa-wallaby-ptg

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/project-config/+/772373
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/horizon/+/771737
Change-Id: I6cc32a57dde4270343ca1f564ddc75f107455d9f

This change hardens the interaction between

This change adds the kernel_id and ramdisk_id

was first converted to an object. those standard

commit_message:
[WIP] harden image metadata storage

This change hardens the interaction between
instnace_system_metadata and image metadata

This change adds the kernel_id and ramdisk_id
image properties that were mised when image metadata
was first converted to an object. those standard
files have been used for many release but were never
proply reprented in image property objects.

Change-Id: I4d3fec578381e2e4ad072247cecb674c4e030f8c

[{'created': '2021-01-20 06:30:35.000000000', 'message': "Make it possible to override ServiceNetMap per-role

In spine-and-leaf TLS-e deployments as done in OSP13,
services are filter based on role networks when adding
metadata for nova-join. This filtering removes valid
services due to the fact that the roles network does'nt
match the global ServiceNetMap.

Add a role based parameter {{role.name}}ServiceNetMap
that can be used to override the ServiceNetMap per-role
when it's being passed to {{role.name}}ServiceChain and
the {{role.name}} resource group.

Related: RHBZ#1875508
Closes-Bug: #1904482
Change-Id: I56b6dfe8a0e95385e469d9eac97a0ec24e147450
(cherry picked from commit be6a844a79d659525e0feecd5a784e4eb55cb021)
"}]
commit_message:
Make it possible to override ServiceNetMap per-role

In spine-and-leaf TLS-e deployments as done in OSP13,
services are filter based on role networks when adding
metadata for nova-join. This filtering removes valid
services due to the fact that the roles network does'nt
match the global ServiceNetMap.

Add a role based parameter {{role.name}}ServiceNetMap
that can be used to override the ServiceNetMap per-role
when it's being passed to {{role.name}}ServiceChain and
the {{role.name}} resource group.

Related: RHBZ#1875508
Closes-Bug: #1904482
Change-Id: I56b6dfe8a0e95385e469d9eac97a0ec24e147450
(cherry picked from commit be6a844a79d659525e0feecd5a784e4eb55cb021)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-03 13:09:39.000000000', 'message': "Use default resource registry for image params

We do env merging on the client side for building/filtering
image params. We don't seem to use the default resource
registry which has service mappings when doing that.

Closes-Bug: #1914396
Change-Id: Ie3fcb2ab509e73d4631e3ef4c9d6ecfad9894112
"}, {'created': '2021-02-03 17:43:41.000000000', 'message': "Fix image parameter update

We need to use default image parameters as we create all
service chains irrespective of role count. We don't seem
to use the default resource registry that would have
service mappings OS::Heat::None that should be used for
filtering.

Closes-Bug: #1914396
Change-Id: Ie3fcb2ab509e73d4631e3ef4c9d6ecfad9894112
"}]
commit_message:
Fix image parameter update

We need to use default image parameters as we create all
service chains irrespective of role count. We don't seem
to use the default resource registry that would have
service mappings OS::Heat::None that should be used for
filtering.

Closes-Bug: #1914396
Change-Id: Ie3fcb2ab509e73d4631e3ef4c9d6ecfad9894112

commit_message:
Add parameter to configure the libvirt max_queues

The maximum number of virtio queue pairs that can be enabled when
creating a multiqueue guest. The number of virtio queues allocated
will be the lesser of the CPUs requested by the guest and the max
value defined.

Conflicts:
  manifests/compute/libvirt.pp
  spec/classes/nova_compute_libvirt_spec.rb

Change-Id: Ieaa29b51257f5ea3a5e4d6c678140fd9ae052d88
(cherry picked from commit 8a6de56193a18678927b4584917246df6bb89b63)
(cherry picked from commit eed4d2dc1bf1db3913edd8dd2fa1140fb4a1abee)

commit_message:
Add note for openflow firewall

Tell something about the config option ``explicitly_egress_direct``
since there is something not so much clear for users now.

Change-Id: I1c046d8140f93d9a8cd9e0bc43d3494e4f6a1ce7

[{'created': '2021-01-19 18:15:29.000000000', 'message': 'Proper log translation

The main idea of the commit is to fix code according with the latest oslo.i18n requirements
https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.i18n/latest/

1. removed log translation if log is not seen by users in raised exception or api call response.
2. keep translated log if it's used in raised exception.
3. fixed log message 'Error while reading %s' which was "dead" (unused) code in the function "_get_value_from_conf_file" of module "agent/linux/dhcp.py".

Partial-Bug: 1600788
Change-Id: Ifb5455336b06c2c87a930b816c90b4a766856b1e

commit_message:
Proper log translation

The main idea of the commit is to fix code
according with the latest oslo.i18n requirements
https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.i18n/latest/

1. removed log translation if log is not seen by users
   in raised exception or api call response.
2. keep translated log if it's used in raised exception.
3. removed log message 'Error while reading %s'
   which was "dead" (unused) code in the function
   "_get_value_from_conf_file"
   of module "agent/linux/dhcp.py".

Partial-Bug: 1600788
Change-Id: Ifb5455336b06c2c87a930b816c90b4a766856b1e

Prepare a new release for victoria

Bumping to 17.6.0 as couple of features and bug fixes
are added since last victoria tag release 17.5.0.

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-02-01 18:55:13.000000000', 'message': 'Deprecate environments/dcn-hci.yaml for dcn-storage.yaml

Rename the file in the environments directory so that it
reflects its expanded scope. This file is used when
deploying storage with DCN sites regardless of if those
sites use HCI. We are now supporting non-HCI DCN sites
with storage so the old name is confusing.

Old name : dcn-hci.yaml
New name : dcn-storage.yaml

commit_message:
Deprecate environments/dcn-hci.yaml for dcn-storage.yaml

Rename the file in the environments directory so that it
reflects its expanded scope. This file is used when
deploying storage with DCN sites regardless of if those
sites use HCI. We are now supporting non-HCI DCN sites
with storage so the old name is confusing.

Old name : dcn-hci.yaml
New name : dcn-storage.yaml

dcn-hci.yaml is depreacated but will remain in the environments
directory for backwards compatibility. dcn-hci.yaml will be
removed during the X cycle.

Change-Id: Ice5e1cfbc158eb6705988706c8625bedb80d7de2
(cherry picked from commit d4ae25e2fd53d1af59fa57947843474cf5c2887a)
(cherry picked from commit 8d0638ecac61681c54b657c02bf140401a416b3a)

commit_message:
Remove --quiet argument from the validator run CLI command.

The validations were always executed in a verbose mode regardless of the
presence of the argument on the command line.

The validations must be executed silently by default and if it is
necessary, the full log could be found in the artifacts directory

Change-Id: I941a8a5174965a6711f22f28f45e05b2ef2aea9f
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud (Strider) <gchamoul@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 7e5c3b1b284c0f5b6c51ec366406667b99577cec)
(cherry picked from commit 9a0498a539d622f8cd3c80d984d5e8e65be4304e)

commit_message:
Allow deploying composable networks without heat

Add option 'network_provision' (default: false).
When enabled composable networks are deployed with
the `openstack overcloud network provision` command
prior to creating the heat stack.

The overcloud-networks-deployed.yaml is added to the
network_args in the deploy command to activate the
network/deployed_networks.yaml template.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/762348
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/751875
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/762652
Change-Id: I842820bfe9998574e53c79a8a4715e637350ad9c

commit_message:
Replace deprecated UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE variable

UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is deprecated and TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is
the new environment variable name that replaces it [1].

This allows to use upper-constraints file as more
readable way instead of UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE=<lower-constraints file>.

[1] https://zuul-ci.org/docs/zuul-jobs/python-roles.html#rolevar-tox.tox_constraints_file
[2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/722814/

Change-Id: I1a0b69de5aa79fd919752a161e32c13ce27fcaa3

Clean up CI

Bump hacking to resolve dependency problems and drop the lower
constraints job. Includes pep8 fixes.

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-01-04 12:21:58.000000000', 'message': 'Refactor nova db config

It is best to avoid placing db creds on the compute nodes to limit the
exposure if an attacker succeeds in gaining access to the hypervisor
host.

Related patches in puppet-nova remove the credentials from nova.conf
however the current scope of db credential hieradata is all nova tripleo
services - so it will but written to the hieradata keys on compute
nodes.

This patch refactors the nova hieradata structure, splitting the
nova-api/nova database hieradata out into individual templates and
selectively including only where necessary, ensuring we have no db
creds on a compute node (unless it is an all-in-one api+compute node).

Conflicts:
	deployment/nova/nova-manager-container-puppet.yaml

Depends-On: I07caa3185427b48e6e7d60965fa3e6157457018c
Change-Id: Ia4a29bdd2cd8e894bcc7c0078cf0f0ab0f97de0a
Closes-bug: #1871482
(cherry picked from commit 9d82364de8d6d1fba083993e085fb8cafcc08268)
'}, {'created': '2021-01-04 12:26:11.000000000', 'message': 'Refactor nova db config

It is best to avoid placing db creds on the compute nodes to limit the
exposure if an attacker succeeds in gaining access to the hypervisor
host.

Related patches in puppet-nova remove the credentials from nova.conf
however the current scope of db credential hieradata is all nova tripleo
services - so it will but written to the hieradata keys on compute
nodes.

This patch refactors the nova hieradata structure, splitting the
nova-api/nova database hieradata out into individual templates and
selectively including only where necessary, ensuring we have no db
creds on a compute node (unless it is an all-in-one api+compute node).

Conflicts:

commit_message:
Refactor nova db config

It is best to avoid placing db creds on the compute nodes to limit the
exposure if an attacker succeeds in gaining access to the hypervisor
host.

Related patches in puppet-nova remove the credentials from nova.conf
however the current scope of db credential hieradata is all nova tripleo
services - so it will but written to the hieradata keys on compute
nodes.

This patch refactors the nova hieradata structure, splitting the
nova-api/nova database hieradata out into individual templates and
selectively including only where necessary, ensuring we have no db
creds on a compute node (unless it is an all-in-one api+compute node).

Conflicts:
	deployment/nova/nova-manager-container-puppet.yaml
        deployment/nova/nova-compute-common-container-puppet.yaml

Depends-On: I07caa3185427b48e6e7d60965fa3e6157457018c
Change-Id: Ia4a29bdd2cd8e894bcc7c0078cf0f0ab0f97de0a
Closes-bug: #1871482
(cherry picked from commit 9d82364de8d6d1fba083993e085fb8cafcc08268)

commit_message:
tool: convert heat network-config to ansible j2

Add a script that does a best effort conversion of
a heat network-config tempalte to an ansible j2
network-config template.

The script uses a networks data file as input to
genereta a map of Heat Parameters to ansible vars.
For parameters not in the generated map the stack
environment is used, parameter values from the
stack environment is hard-coded in the j2 template.

A j2 comment is added whenever a value was hard coded,
in a header comment and also an inline comment if
possible.

NOTE: The j2 reference files in the unit tests was
      created by converting heat templates.

Change-Id: I8165a077b87307ca3c2ebee54703a939517dc9bf

commit_message:
Dropping explicit unicode literal

In python 3, all strings are considered as unicode string.

This patch drops the explicit unicode literal (u'...')
or (u"..") appearances from the unicode strings.

Note: The scope of the patch is to drop unicode literal prefix
from python source code files, documentation and comment are overlook.

Change-Id: I66389d3f4b236a50bd3f193d4e67c2ac10e6ca24

commit_message:
Fix failures and add Update/Scale FT

Cherry-picked the following commits from the master branch.
No functional changes are included.

* 0d7e6a86 Support Scale and Rollback function of FT
* f46885c4 Support Update function of FT
* bf51fb25 Fix for multiple failures in VNF lifecycle
* 8c6a1cb1 Fix `ProblemDetails.detail` from `.details`
* 7b5464e5 Fix the alembic migration for vnf_software_images column types
* 01cf3efd Convert software image properties to byte

In addition, this patch fixes the unstable FT results in zuul FT jobs
with the following change.

https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tacker/+/770609
* test_rollback_instantiate:
  ``depends_on`` in BaseHOT makes stable deletion of stacks, otherwise
  Heat fails to delete subnets due to missing dependency with ports.

Change-Id: Ic27ae0d0addea5ae91f529e28370fac56e992fbd

[{'created': '2021-02-02 07:58:21.000000000', 'message': "Change ARP reply MAC to router interface

In some scenario, dvr router interface will try to ARP some device
which is not hosted in the same host. When the ARP request send
out, the ethernet source MAC will be changed to dvr_host_mac. Then
thoses devices will reply ARP with the dvr_host_mac in ethernet dest
MAC. So finally the dvr router interface will drop this, and the ARP
get failed.

This patch adds one flow for this, it will match the dest MAC, ARP
op-code=2 and arp_tha address, then change the dest MAC to the right
router interface's MAC address.

Closes-Bug: #1913646
Related-Bug: #1859638
Change-Id: Ibc7f01450a3da026ca5c4fb667dada912cf472e3
"}, {'created': '2021-02-03 05:10:38.000000000', 'message': "Change ARP reply MAC to router interface

commit_message:
Change ARP reply MAC to router interface

In some scenario, dvr router interface will try to ARP some device
which is not hosted in the same host. When the ARP request send
out, the ethernet source MAC will be changed to dvr_host_mac. Then
thoses devices will reply ARP with the dvr_host_mac in ethernet dest
MAC. So finally the dvr router interface will drop this, and the ARP
get failed.

This patch adds one flow for this, it will match the dest MAC, ARP
op-code=2 and arp_tha address, then change the dest MAC to the right
router interface's MAC address.

Closes-Bug: #1913646
Related-Bug: #1859638
Change-Id: Ibc7f01450a3da026ca5c4fb667dada912cf472e3

commit_message:
Handle containers with no namespace

Satellite server does not have an actual namespace in the url so the
container location is just host/container:tag. We need to be able to
properly set the headers on blobs without namespaces.

Change-Id: Ia6728d68305ba3c662e99ea067b4d4feef9eeea0
Related-Bug: #1913782

[{'created': '2021-02-01 12:50:03.000000000', 'message': 'Use include_role for conditional inclusion

When import_role is used with a condition, the condition is
applied to all tasks in the role. This is inefficient. If we
use include_role instead, then the role inclusion task is
skipped and none of the tasks in the role are even evaluated.

commit_message:
Use include_role for conditional inclusion

When import_role is used with a condition, the condition is
applied to all tasks in the role. This is inefficient. If we
use include_role instead, then the role inclusion task is
skipped and none of the tasks in the role are even evaluated.

Related-bug: rhbz#1922132

Change-Id: I1b4e26fd4a46599985a989441f493a3ed39237bb
(cherry picked from commit 46df551a0f00cf143ddd5cd9c651b08a13a79fb0)

In spine-and-leaf TLS-e deployments as done in OSP13,

commit_message:
Make it possible to override ServiceNetMap per-role

In spine-and-leaf TLS-e deployments as done in OSP13,
services are filter based on role networks when adding
metadata for nova-join. This filtering removes valid
services due to the fact that the roles network does'nt
match the global ServiceNetMap.

Add a role based parameter {{role.name}}ServiceNetMap
that can be used to override the ServiceNetMap per-role
when it's being passed to {{role.name}}ServiceChain and
the {{role.name}} resource group.

Related: RHBZ#1875508
Closes-Bug: #1904482
Change-Id: I56b6dfe8a0e95385e469d9eac97a0ec24e147450
(cherry picked from commit be6a844a79d659525e0feecd5a784e4eb55cb021)

[{'created': '2020-12-14 15:50:15.000000000', 'message': "DNR test backport of I2ac6bb98e1d4183327e888240fc8d5a70e0d6fcb

Update container-config-scripts/ folder content before update_tasks.

Currently, multiple scripts are being stored in /var/lib/container-config-scripts directory
if any of theses scripts are being used during the update_tasks the content won't be up to
date (or the script will be fully missing if added in a new release), as the content of this
folder is being updated during the deploy tasks (step 1), which occurs after all the
update_tasks.

This patch gathers all the tasks tagged container_config_scripts into a new playbook named
common_container_config_scripts.yaml, this way we can reference the tasks from the
deploy-tasks step1 playbook (as it was happening up to now) and invoke them before the
update_tasks playbook gets called.

Change-Id: I2ac6bb98e1d4183327e888240fc8d5a70e0d6fcb
Related-Bug: #1904193
(cherry picked from commit fb06337465de16108c21446bf89bf55f60434ef5)

commit_message:
Update container-config-scripts/ folder content before update_tasks.

Currently, multiple scripts are being stored in
/var/lib/container-config-scripts directory if any of theses scripts
are being used during the update_tasks the content won't be up to
date (or the script will be fully missing if added in a new release),
as the content of this folder is being updated during the deploy tasks
(step 1), which occurs after all the update_tasks.

This patch gathers the tasks responsible for the folder creation and
content update into a new playbook named common_container_config_scripts.yaml,
this way we can reference the tasks from the deploy-tasks step1 playbook
(as it was happening up to now) and invoke them before the update_tasks
playbook gets called.

Change-Id: I2ac6bb98e1d4183327e888240fc8d5a70e0d6fcb
Related-Bug: #1904193
(cherry picked from commit fb06337465de16108c21446bf89bf55f60434ef5)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-19 09:26:12.000000000', 'message': "Handle disabled CPU features to fix live migration failures

When performing a live migration between hypervisors running
libvirt, where one or more CPU features are disabled, nova does
not take account of these. This results in migration failures
as none of the available hypervisor targets appear compatible.

This patch ensures that the libvirt 'disable' poicy is taken
account of, at least in a basic sense, by explicitly ignoring
items flagged in this way when enumerating CPU features.

Closes-Bug: #1898715
Change-Id: Iaf14ca97cfac99dd280d1114123f2d4bb6292b63

commit_message:
Handle disabled CPU features to fix live migration failures

When performing a live migration between hypervisors running
libvirt, where one or more CPU features are disabled, nova does
not take account of these. This results in migration failures
as none of the available hypervisor targets appear compatible.

This patch ensures that the libvirt 'disable' poicy is taken
account of, at least in a basic sense, by explicitly ignoring
items flagged in this way when enumerating CPU features.

Closes-Bug: #1898715
Change-Id: Iaf14ca97cfac99dd280d1114123f2d4bb6292b63
(cherry picked from commit eeeca4ceff576beaa8558360c8a6a165d716f996)
(cherry picked from commit 45a4110d20a574d0c43431a4b87497920c9cbe06)
(cherry picked from commit b6c473159ec45e0aa715edd45cde28f77484a5f7)

is tracked.

commit_message:
New Project Request: airship/gerrit-to-github-bot

This is a request to create the airship/gerrit-to-github-bot
project in opendev.

This bot synchronizes state between gerrit patchsets, where
airship work is done, and github issues, where airship scope
is tracked.

If you can seed the new gerrit group with me then I can add
the appropriate core team.

The upstream imported project, while created for Airship in
the first place, is essentially abandoned by its owner (hence our
need to import to airship proper to continue enhancing it).
We are unable to clean up the extra feature branch outside of master.

Change-Id: I9c75e12d6b9c2b1c7c4a3047a90e9f80440c3532

commit_message:
[ci] Unblock CI

* Remove listing nova agents from osresources. This API is not available
  anymore
* move tox installation from pre playbook to a role

Change-Id: Ic51f5c82e4ca89b997e2eb1d3d919661061c851f

commit_message:
Switch to uwsgi and enable named uri

This patch brings Magnum in line with other services
by using uwsgi for the api service and replaces the use
of a custom api port with /container-infra.

- Switch to using uwsgi for functional tests.
- Use /container-infra instead of a custom api port.

Change-Id: Iab5b23b3874a46ccb5c942e64dc167258712bd31

commit_message:
Add ansible-role-pki repo

This repo is designed to manage SSL certificates that should be
generated/installed in a unified approach to ease the maintenance.

Change-Id: I42986d9a6ed3744d8df8ead4fe6bfc36ae97c7be
Needed-By: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/governance/+/773383

commit_message:
Disable tgt service under systemd for ironic-agent

this is essentially a follow-up to
Ic62055ac2f9252df832739631bfcbabfac0f9c4e

Ubuntu Xenial and later already uses systemd, and for the same reason
as in that previous patch we have to disable tgt service from starting
in the ironic-python-agent deploy ramdisk.

Change-Id: I3d1593c839535592ac81bca10197bc1a7994ba32
Related-Bug: #1554987

usually if someone want a stable interface names he use the elements "stable-interface-names"which is also used in TripleO to build overcloud images. I think ironic-python-agent does not require biosdevname it has some kind of method implemented in python'}, {'account_id': 25675, 'date': '2018-01-17 01:10:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> usually if someone want a stable interface names he use the
 > elements "stable-interface-names"which is also used in TripleO to
 > build overcloud images. I think ironic-python-agent does not
 > require biosdevname it has some kind of method implemented in
 > python

I didn't see any similar method in python, and I don't think python can get the nic's bios name without system call.

See ironic-python-agent hardware.py:
https://github.com/openstack/ironic-python-agent/blob/master/ironic_python_agent/hardware.py#L595

the collection is always null.'}, {'account_id': 16690, 'date': '2018-01-17 04:46:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

 > the collection is always null.

I'm aware of the use of biosdevname in Python, It's an extra data for interface and not mandatory. Im also using biosdevname with the element I pointed earlier. I don't see reason to force use biosdevname as customers something use other Linux means to name their interfaces'}, {'account_id': 16690, 'date': '2018-04-30 09:21:00.000000000', 'content': 'Removed reviewer Noam Angel with the following votes:

commit_message:
Add biosdevname package for ironic agent element.

Ironic python agent use biosdevname command collecting
the BIOS given NICs name.

Change-Id: I7f88b17c786897685307dcf000adfddc22e07c73

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-09-21 13:12:58.000000000', 'message': 'ovn: Always use UTC for Hash ring timestamps

When a node is created in ovn_hash_ring table, it used to use timestamp
depending on the system or mysql timezone. This caused troubles for
machines using western timezones when getting active nodes before the
first liveness check, becaus the time difference between UTC and local
time was always in hours and the limit is 30 seconds.

This patch configures OVN Hash Ring model to always use UTC when
creating a node so the times are always compared to UTC, regardless of
the used timezone. Note that the created_at and updated_at are not user
facing columns.

Conflicts:
        neutron/tests/unit/common/ovn/test_hash_ring_manager.py
        neutron/tests/unit/db/test_ovn_hash_ring_db.py

Change-Id: I9172254ce9b1880833128bdcaacacb93821933dd
Closes-bug: #1894117
Signed-off-by: Jakub Libosvar <libosvar@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit a84462f698f91b10e332e3403ecc9a68c3e6a884)

commit_message:
ovn: Always use UTC for Hash ring timestamps

When a node is created in ovn_hash_ring table, it used to use timestamp
depending on the system or mysql timezone. This caused troubles for
machines using western timezones when getting active nodes before the
first liveness check, becaus the time difference between UTC and local
time was always in hours and the limit is 30 seconds.

This patch configures OVN Hash Ring model to always use UTC when
creating a node so the times are always compared to UTC, regardless of
the used timezone. Note that the created_at and updated_at are not user
facing columns.

Conflicts:
        neutron/tests/unit/common/ovn/test_hash_ring_manager.py
        neutron/tests/unit/db/test_ovn_hash_ring_db.py

Change-Id: I9172254ce9b1880833128bdcaacacb93821933dd
Closes-bug: #1894117
Signed-off-by: Jakub Libosvar <libosvar@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit a84462f698f91b10e332e3403ecc9a68c3e6a884)

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2021-02-02 06:06:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)

This whole thing is a complete mess, and has been marked as deprecated in the README.  We've worked quite hard to purge it from infra images ... honestly, the amount of time we should all spend reviewing this is minimal.

Is it possible to just drop this from wherever it is being used and install pip via some other mechanism?  specifically, do you actually *need* the latest pip in the image, or could you just install the system's pip package and be good?"}, {'account_id': 20676, 'date': '2021-02-02 07:13:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2021-02-02 09:00:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1

While, using latest pip is almost essential, I would not slow down this fix because I find it likely
to fail again due to current approach.

I know well what is happening with python packaging and using latest tools is key for two reasons: changes related to packacing (PEP-517 related) and second, ability to make use of bug fixes like
the new resolver.

The new resolver uncovered the amount of mess we had and the only sad thing is that pip team
did not manage to do it like 5 years ago.

I know that historically pip proved to be a PITA, but many thing changed during the last two years, so many that now I think we are in bigger trouble using outdated versions than using latest. Their QA process improved a lot.'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2021-02-02 16:01:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2

The idea here is that we try to find a version of get-pip.py which will work on all our platforms, and use it to bootstrap latest usable pip for each platform (by upgrading pip). As Ian says, we need to rip out the pip-and-virtualenv element anyway, so I'm not concerned about long-term maintenance of whatever we do here in the short term."}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2021-02-02 21:41:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2021-02-03 00:01:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

If this helps I'm happy to go with it"}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2021-02-03 21:27:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Hi all, thanks for fixing this, may I ask what's the plan to make new release (pypi version) for diskimage-builder?"}]

commit_message:
Install last stable version of get-pip.py script

The get-pip script does not work well with Python 2 and
it raise error during the installation [1].

[1] https://github.com/pypa/get-pip/issues/83

Change-Id: I3755c34da313ef647547c6ae18b59cc04c2cdd60

commit_message:
Update SSL instructions to new standard

Updating the documentation to recommend
using the new standard for generating ssl
certificates with alt_names. The use of
CommonNames has been deprecated for some time.

Closes #1906387

Change-Id: Ifb02aa5007b74b25936b4ae253e493747039b229
